material.mattext: Compare and contrast the graduation rates distributions of the different colleges. Be sure to address center, spread and outliers.

Click here to see the descriptive statistics and the graph. Note that these might look a little different than the ones you generated depending on the version of Excel you are using, but the values should be the same. Center:
Of the six colleges, college D has the highest median graduatation rate (M==79), followed by college F (M=72), B (M=70.15), C (M=67.65), A (M=63.75) and college E (M=59.15).

Spread:
College B has the smallest variation in graduation rates over the years (range = 9.4%, IQR = 3.5%). College D's graduation rates are also pretty consistent over the years (range = 10.5%, IQR = 4.45%). A larger variation in graduation rates is found in college E and C, and the least consistency in graduation rates (i.e., largest variation)is found in colleges A (range: 30.6%, IQR: 19.55%) and college F (range: 29.7%, IQR:16.23%).

None of the graduation rates distributions have outliers.
